meanings.definition: Resembling paper in thinness or texture.
meanings.sent1: The leaves had a papery feel to them.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped the gift in papery tissue.
meanings.sent3: The papery sound of the wind rustling through the trees made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His voice was as papery as a delicate sheet of parchment.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a papery scent that brought back memories.

meanings.sent1: The artist created a papery sculpture out of recycled materials.
meanings.sent2: The papery bag crinkled as she carried it home.
meanings.sent3: The papery hat she wore to the party was a hit with her friends.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was light and papery, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The delicate papery wings of the butterfly shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The papery petals of the flower wilted in the heat.
meanings.sent2: His papery skin showed the signs of age.
meanings.sent3: The papery sound of her footsteps on the dry leaves made her jump.
meanings.sent4: Her papery voice trembled with emotion as she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The papery wings of the moth fluttered gently in the night.
